Ghouls are a humanoid race and the descendants of a long-dead society that degraded to the point that its people ate their dead.[1] They feed on the rotting flesh of bodies scavenged from grave sites and battlefields. Their appetite for dead bodies is the reason they are found just north of Canifis outside the mausoleum in the graveyard. Players can quickly reach ghouls by using the Canifis lodestone.

Ghouls are not undead. They are in fact still alive and immune to the effects of the Salve amulet and Salve amulet (e).

Although the race as a whole is almost completely mindless, at least one non-violent ghoul known as Gus appears to have intelligence comparable to that of a human. Gus also appears to be the only ghoul (besides the Ghoul Champion) who resides west of the River Salve.

These monsters can be killed for 38 Slayer experience each when on a Slayer assignment for ghouls. They do not hit well against players with high defences, although they will occasionally damage even players at quite high levels.

The graveyard is an excellent place to use a Dwarf Cannon, due to the many ghouls and their fast respawn. This strategy can yield a lot of ranged experience and Slayer if killed for an assignment.

A ghoul bone, a special drop, is necessary to collect during the wish list after the Rag and Bone Man quest.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
North of Canifis50None24Maplink

Champion's Challenge[edit | edit source]

Ghouls are one of the 'races' who have lesser champions in the Champion's Challenge Distraction and Diversion. To fight the Ghoul Champion, the player must kill ghouls until one drops a Champion's scroll, a very rare drop.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 137,698 samples from the Drop Log Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Ghoul kill is worth 1,016 coins.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 12 February 2024 (Update):
    • Rebalanced several low level monsters that were harder to kill than intended
  • patch 23 October 2017 (Update):
    • Ghouls no longer spawn within trees in the Canifis graveyard.
  • ninja 25 April 2016 (Update):
    • Improved respawn rates for Ghouls.
  • update 11 April 2016 (Update):
    • Graphically updated. Moved location from outside the Slayer Tower to the cemetery north of Canifis.
  • update 14 October 2004 (Update):
    • Added to game.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Canifis. Jagex. (Archived from the original on 17 July 2016.) "Ghouls are the savage remnants of a society that fell, many centuries ago, into eating their dead. In modern times they are a rare species, but can be relied upon to be found near graveyards, where they dig up the bodies and feast on rotting flesh. They fight without weapons and tear at their enemies with malformed fingers."
